title: Eat Me
medium: Colored pencil, gesso, and found cosmetics on paper
alt: Self-portrait with pastel pink ground and a silver spoon hovering above cereal held in the artist's mouth.
statement: Commissioned for CONTRAST 2025, the drawing weaponises sweetness—granting passive permission while daring the viewer to accept an impossible offer.

title: Not Very Palatable
alt: Pink-toned portrait dissolving into abstraction against a blush field.
statement: Anxieties around being consumed collapse into painterly paste, oscillating between seductive surface and stomach-turning grit.

title: What Did You Expect?
medium: Colored pencil and acrylic on paper
alt: Detail of a face bisected by saturated pink shadow.
statement: Portraiture as provocation: a hot pink shadow scrutinises the assumptions woven into performance.

title: Portals 1–6
medium: Colored pencil and acrylic on paper
alt: Grid of cropped mouths rendered in mauves and blushes.
statement: Six studies rehearse micro-expressions, each mouth a doorway that negotiates secrecy, desire, and refusal.

title: Key of Bliss
alt: Horizontal drawing of an elongated spoon-like form floating on blush ground.
statement: A devotional utensil floats like sheet music—equal parts spoon, tuning fork, and key to the body’s private chamber.

title: Ouroboros
alt: Looped ribbon of flesh painted in pinks encircling itself.
statement: A ribbon of flesh curls back on itself, staging the endless loop of anxiety feeding on relief.

title: Drainage
medium: Graphite and ink on Stonehenge paper
alt: Bleeding bouquet of organs rendered in graphite against a pink wash.
statement: Organs bloom into a bouquet, mapping where excess feeling decants and how vulnerability leaks into the room.

title: Extraction
medium: Graphite and ink on Stonehenge paper
alt: Large drawing of hands and teeth pulling tension across the page.
statement: Hands, teeth, and taut strings hold competing forces of grip and release—the labour of translating trauma into language.

title: Don't You Ever Get Lonely Down There?
alt: Wide painting of a figure submerged in pink voids.
statement: A panoramic gouache lodges the figure underground, asking who tends to our subterranean selves.

title: I'm Sorry We Forgot
alt: Relief sculpture of mouths and teeth glazed in pink confectionary tones.
statement: Candy-coated teeth and resin reliquaries archive apologies that were never spoken aloud.

title: They Must Love You
medium: Charcoal and graphite on Stonehenge paper
alt: Graphite portrait with ribbons of blush diffusing around the face.
statement: Graphite ribbons spiral around a scrutinised face, balancing praise with the prickliness of surveillance.

title: Summer Self-Portrait no. 1
alt: Charcoal self-portrait with windblown hair on a pale ground.
statement: Windbreaks of charcoal track how summer heat and exhaustion reshape the self mid-season.

title: Summer Self-Portrait no. 2
alt: Graphite portrait staring directly at the viewer.
statement: A second study holds eye contact—equal parts challenge and confession, refusing to look away.
